subsection.name: Description
subsection.div:
Checks that a
javadoc block tag appears only at the beginning of a line, ignoring leading asterisks and white space. A block tag is a token that starts with @ symbol and is preceded by a whitespace. This check ignores block tags in comments and inside inline tags {@code } and {@literal }.
subsection.p:
Rationale: according to
the specification all javadoc block tags should be placed at the beginning of a line. Tags that are not placed at the beginning are treated as plain text. To recognize intentional tag placement to text area it is better to escape the @ symbol, and all non-escaped tags should be located at the beginning of the line. See NOTE section for details on how to escape.

subsection.name: Notes

tr.td: Specify the javadoc tags to process.

td.code: author, deprecated, exception, hidden, param, provides, return, see, serial, serialData, serialField, since, throws, uses, version

tr.td: Control when to print violations if the Javadoc being examined by this check violates the tight html rules defined at Tight-HTML Rules.

subsection.name: Examples

pre.code: /** * Escaped tag @version (OK) * Plain text with {@code @see} (OK) * A @custom tag (OK) * */

subsection.p: To configure the check to verify tags from JEP 8068562 only:

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="JavadocBlockTagLocation"> <property name="tags" value="apiNote, implSpec, implNote"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.p: To configure the check to verify all default tags and some custom tags in addition:

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="JavadocBlockTagLocation"> <!-- default tags --> <property name="tags" value="author, deprecated, exception, hidden"/> <property name="tags" value="param, provides, return, see, serial"/> <property name="tags" value="serialData, serialField, since, throws"/> <property name="tags" value="uses, version"/> <!-- additional tags used in the project --> <property name="tags" value="noinspection"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.
